title: Everest Base Camp (Nepal)
subtitle: Footsteps to the world’s roof
about: Everest Base Camp is the world’s most famous high-altitude trek, threading Sherpa villages, suspension bridges and high viewpoints on the way to the Khumbu icefall. It’s a cultural and physical journey that culminates at the tipping point of Everest climbing.
seo_title: Everest Base Camp Trek — Khumbu Expedition
seo_description: Iconic trek through Sherpa country ending at Everest Base Camp. High altitude, deep culture and legendary views.

trek_places.name: Lukla
trek_places.short: Tiny airstrip and gateway to Khumbu
trek_places.about: Lukla’s short airstrip is the practical gateway to EBC. The town is a jumble of guesthouses, tea shops and trekking logistics—expect brisk energy and last-minute gear runs.
what_to_do: Confirm permits and flights to Kathmandu
Meet Sherpa crew and check kit
Begin acclimatisation walks on the lower trails

trek_places.name: Namche Bazaar
trek_places.short: High Sherpa market and acclimatisation hub
trek_places.about: Namche is the main acclimatisation stop with bakeries, gear shops and a lively market. Trekkers linger here for two nights to adjust and relish the unique mountain culture.
what_to_do: Acclimatise and hike to nearby viewpoints
Stock up on supplies and enjoy bakeries
Visit Sherpa museums and cultural exhibits
